Config.OutDir.Description:
The path to save the converted files to.

Note: The path may be relative to the markdown-file that is to be converted.
Config.IgnoreLanguageMode.Description: true to convert the current file even if it's not opened in Markdown-mode; otherwise false.
Config.ConversionQuality.Description: The quality of the rendered file.
Config.ConversionType.Description: Either a single or a set of types to convert the markdown-file to.
Config.Locale.Description:
The locale to print the date.

Note:
Overrides VSCode's locale.
Config.DateFormat.Description:
A format-string to print the date
See: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/8kb3ddd4(v=vs.110).aspx
Config.Document.EmojiType.Description:
The emoji-type to use.

Note:
You could also set this to true to use github-emojis or set this to false to disable emojis.
Config.Document.Attributes.Description:
The attributes of the document.
They can be included into the document like this: {{ AttributeName }}.
Config.Document.Attributes.Author: Author
Config.Document.Attributes.Author.Descri: Overrides the fullname of the current user.
Config.Document.Paper.PaperFormat.Descri:
The dimensions of the rendered document.
Either the width and the height of the paper or a predefined format.
The width of the paper.
Valid units are: 'mm', 'cm', 'in', 'px'. No unit means 'px'
Config.Document.Paper.PaperFormat.Height:
The height of the paper.
Valid units are: 'mm', 'cm', 'in', 'px'. No unit means 'px'
Config.Document.Paper.Margin.Top.Descrip:
The top margin.
Valid units are: 'mm', 'cm', 'in', 'px'. No unit means 'px'
Config.Document.Paper.Margin.Right.Descr:
The right margin.
Valid units are: 'mm', 'cm', 'in', 'px'. No unit means 'px'
Config.Document.Paper.Margin.Bottom.Desc:
The bottom margin.
Valid units are: 'mm', 'cm', 'in', 'px'. No unit means 'px'
Config.Document.Paper.Margin.Left.Descri:
The left margin.
Valid units are: 'mm', 'cm', 'in', 'px'. No unit means 'px'
Config.Document.HeaderFooterEnabled.Desc:
This option enables the rendering of headers and footers.

Note:
Script-tags are not supported inside the header and the footer.
Config.Document.HeaderTemplate.Descripti:
The content of the header.
You can insert the page-number and the total amount of pages by using the CSS-classes `pageNumber` and `totalPages`.
Config.Document.Toc.Enabled.Description: Enables the rendering of a table of contents using `markdown-it-table-of-contents`.
Config.Document.Toc.Class.Description: The css-class of the table of contents.
Config.Document.Toc.Levels.Description:
The heading-levels to include into the table of contents.

Example:
"2-6" or "2, 3, 4, 5, 6".
Config.Document.Toc.Indicator.Descriptio: The RegExp that is to be replaced with the table of contents.
Config.Document.Toc.ListType.Description:
The list-type of the table of contents.
The list can either be numbered ("ol") or not numbered ("ul").
Config.Document.Design.Template.Descript:
The path to the template of the document.
Note: {{{styles}}}'s replaced by the css-styles
{{{content}}}'s replaced by the body of the document.
Config.Document.Design.HighlightStyle.De:
The highlight.js-style to use.

Note:
You could also set this to true to use VS Code's default theme, or set this to false to disable hightlighting.
Config.Document.Design.SystemStylesEnabl: true to use system-provided styles; otherwise false.
Config.Document.Design.StyleSheets.Descr:
Stylesheets to include in the document.
They can either be a local path or an URI.
